project.teaser: The proposed project: Initiative of Fostering cross-border knowledge exchange and co-creation on sustainable soil and farm management (Soil-X-Change) will help to connect farmers, actors, policy makers, projects, and initiatives to speed up innovation and promote faster...
project.objective: The proposed project: Initiative of Fostering cross-border knowledge exchange and co-creation on sustainable soil and farm management (Soil-X-Change) will help to connect farmers, actors, policy makers, projects, and initiatives to speed up innovation and promote faster, wider co-creation and transposition of innovative solutions into practice. It will contribute to effective AKIS by intensifying thematic cooperation between researchers, farmers, and other stakeholders in the EU. Soil-X-Change will also contribute to the green transition, smart agriculture, climate-neutrality, and sustainability areas, as well as enhancing and exchanging the knowledge of the main actors. Soil-X-Change, initiated by EIP-AGRI Operational Group practitioners (OGs), reflects the needs of 151 direct partners. It will collect, combine, harmonise, analyse and integrate the results and data product developed by the different EIP-AGRI OGs and the project partners. Soil-X-Change will disseminate and share innovative practices across 9 member countries. Furthermore, the Soil-X-Change project will bring together EIP OGs and key stakeholders working on sustainable soil and farm management to create an EU-wide network, share knowledge, and introduce ready-to-use practices that will enable farmers to make the right decisions related to agricultural production practices. At the end of the project the extended knowledge and innovative ideas of member and non-member OGs will widen the scope of their activities and showcasing their result to an increased number of stakeholders and farmers in an international environment and network across EU countries. Soil-X-Change will use a bottom-up approach (farmers to OGs) and will reinforce and share practical knowledge using the main dissemination channels suitable for farmers and practitioners.
project.title: Fostering cross-border knowledge exchange and co-creation on sustainable soil and farm management
project.keywords: EIP Operational Groups, Soil management, Climate change, Knowledge uptake and deployment

article.title: Accelerating implementation of innovative solutions for sustainable soil and farm management

result.title: Initial Risk Management Plan (RMP)
result.description: Description of risk mitigation strategies and the application of contingency planning throughout the project. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 1.3.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Soil-X-Change (Fostering cross-border knowledge exchange and co-creation on sustainable soil and farm management)
result.teaser: This initiative of fostering cross-border knowledge exchange and co-creation on sustainable soil and farm management (Soil-X-Change) help to connect farmers, actors, policy makers, projects, and initiatives to speed up innovation and promote faster, wider co-creation and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: A well-developed and documented database including survey results
result.description: Description of data collection, storage and terminology including categorized metadata of collected “model” soil and farm management practices and survey results. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 4.1 and 4.2.

result.title: Initial guideline for network establishment, governance and management
result.description: Description of the Soil-X-Change Net structure, its bodies, participants and their roles; rules for national node establishment and operation and rules for interactions and flow of information. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 2.1.

result.title: 9 Letter of support signed by AKIS Coordination bodies from Member states
result.description: 9 signed Letter of support by AKIS CBs ensuring engagement and connection to Soil-X-Change project over the entire project lifetime. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 2.3.

result.title: Analysis report of the survey data
result.description: A report that details the differences in the adoption of soil and crop management practices and assessment to identify drivers of farmers' preferences towards technology adoption based on the survey results. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 4.2.

result.title: Updated Communication and dissemination plan including Exploitation Strategy
result.description: Updated plan including the communication, dissemination and exploitation strategy for the project. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 6.1.

result.title: Initial engagement metrics analysis report including actions for improvement
result.description: Report on the web and social media engagement metrics, including recommendations for improvement. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 6.2.

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: Description of the data management life cycle for the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by the project, ensuring the research data is findable, accessible, interoperable and re-usable (FAIR).This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 1.4.

result.title: Project image and website
result.description: Soil-X-Change dedicated image and website. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 6.2.

result.title: Updated engagement metrics analysis report including actions for improvement
result.description: Report on the web and social media engagement metrics, including recommendations for improvement. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 6.2.

result.title: Established social media channels
result.description: Soil-X-Change dedicated and use of partners social media channels. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 6.2.

result.title: Project Management Handbook
result.description: Description of proper administrative, technical and financial coordination of the consortium including project management structure, project and WP supervision, internal meeting requirements and instructions to offset carbon emission provoked by project travels. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 1.1.

result.title: Initial Synergy Map of EU networks, similar projects and initiatives
result.description: Description of thematically related networks, projects and initiatives at various platforms in project member and non-member countries This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 2.4.

result.title: Initial Communication and dissemination plan including Exploitation Strategy
result.description: Plan including the communication, dissemination and exploitation strategy for the project. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 6.1.

result.title: Updated Synergy Map of EU networks, similar projects and initiative
result.description: Updated description of thematically related networks, projects and initiatives at various platforms in project member and non-member countries This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 2.4.

result.title: Quality Plan (QP)
result.description: Description of quality assurance procedures (including peer review of deliverables) and a monitoring methodology for supervising tasks, milestones and budget. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 1.3.

result.title: Outcome report of events organized with AKISs in the first half of the project
result.description: A report that details the outcomes, take-aways and further actions of events held with AKISs in the first half of the project. This deliverable will result from the undertaking of Task 2.2 and 2.3.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
